data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It is always forward to face forward. One who takes 10 steps forward to the right.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around, you’re going to get back down at the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It can take you 6 steps of 1st route to get you to the starting point. And it only takes 4 steps in the first direction. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right and take another 7 left. Take 1 extra step and turn right. The return to starting point is 7 - 7 = 7. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 10 steps to return to start point. Turn left. Take 3 steps for 10 steps back. Take 3 steps for 9 steps back. Take 3 steps for 9 steps back. Take 5 steps back. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around the left turn around the right turn takes 7 steps on an upside down plane to return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first item says Turn Right. When you do the first item all of the steps are the same. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 2 steps to take back to the beginning start at first place. Taking 6 steps does not get you back at the start place. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person who always faces left can not return to the starting point. Therefore, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 7 steps because that is the number of steps you need to take when you want to return to the starting point. These steps will take you to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In the first step forward you always have to be facing forward. In the second step backward you usually have to take one step backward. In the third step backward you usually have to take one step backward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 3 different directions to get back to the starting point. The first instruction is to start facing forward when you would be taken out of the way. The second instruction is to never face forward and to always always forward. The third instruction is to always take 2 steps left and to always take 8 steps right. The fourth instruction is to always always face forward and take 8 steps left. The fifth instruction is to always always face forward and take 8 steps right. The sixth instruction is to always always face forward and take 2 steps left and to always always take 2 steps left. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions point forward. If you follow the instructions, you always face forward. If you take the right directions, you always take the right way. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first steps are always toward the right. The fourth step is from the same direction as the first step. The second step is from the left. The third step is to the right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
After you return to the starting point, you still have 6 steps further than you started with. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you follow the instructions to turn right, you turn around right. If you turn left, you turn around left. If you take 4 steps, then you take 4 steps. If you take 8 steps, then you take 8 steps. If you do all of the above, you can only take 8 steps. So, the answer is No.

Take 10 steps first to get 4 steps up the chain and then turn around take 9 steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

Take 7 steps. Turn around take 9 steps. Turn right take 9 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When you turn around, you are facing the starting point. The starting point is where the next step is. Turn around and turn around in reverse if you are facing the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

No action if one takes only 1 step, no action if one takes 5 steps, no action if one takes 4 steps, no action if one takes 7 steps, no action if one takes 8 steps, no action if one takes 10 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 3 steps. Turn left. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning left takes 6 steps, but take 3 steps first. To turn left, take 1 step first, then 3 steps, then 6 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you turn around, you take five steps and you return to the starting point in five steps. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You can turn around and take up 7 steps to get to the starting point. You can take down 3 steps and turn around. You can take up 7 steps and take up 4 steps to get back to the starting point. So the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You can’ t take any number of steps backwards because you are in motion. Even if you take 5 steps backwards, you only take 7 steps forward. You cannot take 1 step forward, 6 steps backwards or 3 steps backwards. So, the answer is No.

Always face forward. You can take all 7 steps backward without returning to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Turn around and take 4 steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you should always take the same path to repeat the same steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. So, the answer is No.

You take 2 steps backward. You take 3 steps backward. You take 8 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you take 1 step to return to the starting point, you can do this every step. Thus, the answer is No.

You turn around from the starting point to get back to your place of starting. So, the answer is yes.

The only way to get back to the beginning is with 7 steps back from the starting point. The answer: No.

If the instructions were all one step, then you would have 3 steps. If they are listed in 7 steps then you return to 5 steps. In this case it would take you 6 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 2 steps backward, go 1 step forward, and then repeat the rest of the process. The starting point is the same regardless if you face forward or not. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 2 steps to make it back to the starting point. If you take 8 steps you are back in the starting point. In the instructions take 2 steps to get to the starting point and 8 steps to make it back to where you start from. So, the answer is No.

Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you’ll always go forward. If you always face backward, you’ll always go back. The steps are counter-intuitive since you’ll always have 6 steps backward. The answer: no.

You can walk for a given amount of time toward a given direction. The direction in which you' re forward is different depending on what direction you are. So, the answer is No.

Turn left and get to opposite. Turn right and get to opposite. The answer is No.

Five steps backward is in contradiction to 2 steps forward. One never faces forward. So, the answer is No.

Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
After you take 7 steps backward, your back step is 1 step forward, so you took 10 steps forward before. The answer: No.

When you are facing forward you should always assume that you are facing upward. The starting point is the horizon and never faces forward. So, the answer is No.
